ClassScheme.Name: SKOS semantic relations
ClassScheme.Description: Semantic relations between concepts defined by the Simple Knowledge Organization System (SKOS), see https://www.w3.org/TR/skos-reference/#semantic-relations

Class.Definition: Concept1 is in more general in meaning ("broader") than Concept2: the explicit statement.
Class.Description: To be only used to assert a direct (i.e., immediate) hierarchical link between two concepts.

Class.Term: more general in meaning (derived transitive closure)
Class.Definition: Concept1 is in more general in meaning ("broader") than Concept2: the transitive closure of the explicit statements.
Class.Description: Not to be used to make assertions, use 385d4406-5a17-4cba-bb61-1178a6eb27aa instead. This is useful for constructing and retrieving the transitive closure of the explicit assertions.

Class.Definition: Concept1 is related to Concept2 (and vice versa)
